business.headline: Sensex, Nifty open higher for 3rd consecutive session; Adani stocks up 6%Share market today: The S&P BSE Sensex surged 419.86 points to 77,143.94, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 127.65 points to 23,340.85 as of 9:30 AM.

LTCG tax relief in Budget 2025? What stock market investors are hoping forStock markets are buzzing with anticipation for the upcoming budget, especially after the Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman announced key changes to capital gains taxation in her seventh Budget.

Budget 2025: Is merging old and new income tax regimes a good idea?Budget 2025: Will merging the old and new tax regimes offer the best of both worlds for taxpayers? Experts weigh in on whether a unified system could simplify compliance or introduce new challenges.
Budget 2025: 10 key financial terms every taxpayer must knowThe Union Budget 2025 will be presented by Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman on February 1.
Budget 2025: 3 key expectations of homebuyersThe housing sector plays an important role in India's GDP and employment generation, raising hopes for reforms to reduce costs and promote homeownership.

Sensex up 500 points, Nifty continues positive run. What investors should doStock market today: The Sensex hit an intraday high of 76,991.05 and was trading 463.37 points higher at 76,963 at 10:55 am. The Nifty50 also rose 110.40 points to 23,286.45.

Adani Green share price surges over 6% in early trade. What's driving the rally?Adani Green share price: At 10:20 am, the stock was trading 3.28% higher at Rs 1,040.60, continuing its positive momentum after jumping as much as 19% in the previous session.
Sensex, Nifty open higher; IT stocks rebound after recent slumpThe S&P BSE Sensex gained 144.53 points to76,644.16, while the NSE Nifty50 added 16.15 points to23,192.20 as of 9:30 AM.
PepsiCo enters bidding for Haldiram stake against Temasek, Alpha Wave: ReportPepsiCo has initiated discussions with the Aggarwal family, who own Haldiram, for a minority stake.

entertainment.headline: House of cards actor Kevin Spacey given bail, what happens to #metoo now?From American Beauty to House of Cards, one of the most lauded actors of his generation, Kevin Spacey has a tainted reputation. In a new turn, the Oscar-winning actor "strenuously" denied allegations of sexual assault against him and got bail. Watch to know more

Images of Nayantara wearing sandals inside Tirupati temple sparks outrage against newlywed coupleAfter the grand wedding between Nayantara and Vignesh, the couple went to the Tirupati temple to offer prayers.However, images of Nayantara wearing footwear inside the temple area has sparked outrage among the devotees against the couple.While Vignesh was spotted walking barefoot, Nayantara was seen wearing sandals, which caused a massive uproar amongst devotees in the area.Temple authorities issued a clarification saying it was permitted for devotees to wear footwear in that area.

Cannes Film Festival 2022: Deepika, Aishwarya walk the red carpet; Indian pavilion inauguratedThe 75th annual Cannes Film Festival began on May 17. Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and Deepika Padukone walked the red carpet on Day 3 of the 10-day film festival. On the second day, May 18, Union Minister for I&B, Youth Affairs & Sports, Anurag Thakur, inaugurated the India Pavilion at the Cannes Film Festival. The special event was also attended by several Indian celebrities, including Deepika Padukone, R. Madhavan, Nawazuddin Siddiqui, Tamannaah Bhatia and others.Deepika Padukone, who is part of the Cannes 2022 jury, talked about Indian films at the event and said that she believes there will be a day when Cannes will be in India.
Disco king Bappi Lahiri passes away at 69 Singer-composer Bappi Lahiri passed away on Wednesday, February 16, at a Mumbai hospital. He was 69.

Andheri court summons Shilpa Shetty, Shamita, their mother Sunanda The Andheri court has issued summons to Bollywood actress Shilpa Shetty, her sister Shamita and their mother Sunanda over non-repayment of loan.

general news.headline: Saif Ali Khan attacked with knife during burglary attempt, undergoes surgery Live UpdatesBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was injured after an unidentified attacker stabbed him with a knife at his Bandra home in a burglary attempt. After the attack, the actor was admitted to Mumbai'sLilavati Hospital and was reportedly out of danger.

Saif Ali Khan was attacked in his children's room, suffers 2 deep stab woundsBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was attacked at his Bandra home in a burglary attempt. He is currently undergoing surgery at Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital.

Biden warns against 'oligarchy, dangerous concentration of power' in farewell speechJoe Biden is set to leave the White House on January 20, paving the way for his successor Donald Trump to return for a second stint as the US President.

Nate Anderson's Hindenburg Research to shut shop. Here's whyNate Anderson, the man behind Hindenburg Research, announced the decision in a detailed post, explaining that the firm's work is complete, and it is time to move on.

Ravinage over retinol? Experts decode the better pick for your skinThere's a growing buzz online about ravinage, a plant-based alternative to retinol, being better for your skin. But is there any truth to the claims? We turned to experts to help dissect the facts.

Not in IQ or EQ, real story of Congress and BJP is in HQThe evolution of the headquarters of the Congress and BJP tells the story of their organisational journey and priorities. While the BJP swiftly built a modern, tech-savvy central office in less than two years, the Congress clung to an outdated set-up at 24, Akbar Road for five decades. This is what the two HQs reveal.

Saif Ali Khan fought intruder, Kareena, sons were at home during attack: SourcesActor Saif Ali Khan was attacked with a knife at his Bandra home and is currently hospitalised. Kareena Kapoor Khan and the children, Taimur and Jeh, were at home during the attack. Saif faced the intruder head-on to protect the family.

Israel, Hamas reach ceasefire deal to end 15-month Gaza war, release hostagesThe six-week initial agreement which will come into effect on January 19 will see the gradual withdrawal of Israeli forces from Gaza, and release of the Hamas-held hostagesin exchange for Palestinian prisoners taken into custody by Israel.

Not anyone linked to Mike Pence, Nikki Haley: Trump hires people for administrationTrump made the announcement in a Truth Social post on Wednesday in which he also said that he would not consider individuals associated with some of his Republican rivals and critics, including his former Vice President Mike Pence and "birdbrain" Nikki Haley.

Day 5 Live Updates: De Minaur, Rybakina in actionAustralian Open 2025 Day 5 Live Updates: Alex De Minaur and Elena Rybakina are in action in the second round of the Australian Open and have won their respective first sets. Earlier on in the day, Iga Swiatek has made it to round 3 with relative ease, dispatching Sramkova 6-0, 6-2. Ons Jabeur was able to overcome a wobble in the first set to beat Camila Osorio and make it to the next round. Emma Raducanu also progressed to the 3rd round in Melbourne for the first time in her career. Later on, World No. 1 Jannik Sinner and Indian players Rithvik Choudary Bollipalli and N. Sriram Balaji are set to compete on Day 5 of the Australian Open 2025 on January 16.

No car, no house: Arvind Kejriwal declares assets worth Rs 1.73 crore ahead of pollsFormer Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday filed his nomination for the Assembly polls. In his affidavit submitted to the Election Commission, Kejriwal declared assets worth Rs 1.73 crore, revealing that he owns neither a house nor a car.

Overnight rain in parts of Delhi-NCR intensifies cold, AQI improves slightlyDelhi Weather: Delhi and nearby areas witnessed light rain on Thursday as the national capital grappled with chilly winters. The visibility improved in parts of Delhi-NCR after the rain.

Housing, toilet, freebies boost women's voting: MP leads; Punjab, Haryana trailA study says 18 million more women voted in the 2024 Lok Sabha polls, driven by better literacy, jobs, housing and sanitation, and schemes like PMAY and Mudra loans

Jasprit Bumrah laughs off reports of him being advised bed rest after Australia tourStar India fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah mocked an X page for spreading fake news about his fitness. Bumrah got injured during the fifth Test vs Australia in Sydney and opted not to bowl from Day 2 onwards.

Woman dies by suicide, family alleges harassment by husband over English skillsThe 19-year-old woman died by suicide in Kerala's Malappuram district. Her family alleged that harassment by her husband and in-laws over her complexion and limited English proficiency drove her to take her own life.

Watch: Fan crashes his car while trying to click a selfie with Sam KonstasA fan crashed his car while trying to click a selfie with rising young Australian cricketer Sam Konstas, who recently made his debut during the Test series against India.

Drake sues Universal Music Group over alleged defamation campaignRapper Drake has taken legal action against Universal Music Group, claiming the label defamed him through the diss track - Not Like Us - by Kendrick Lamar. The lawsuit alleges a malicious campaign to spread false narratives about Drake.

How an NGO connect to Delhi hoax bomb emails sparked a political row The hoax bomb threat case in Delhi, which initially appeared to be the work of a minor prankster, became the focal point of intense political sparring between the ruling AAP and the BJP.

Meet IIT Baba, aerospace engineer whose quest for truth led him to spiritualismBaba Abhay Singh of Juna Akhara, an IIT-alumnus and former aerospace engineer, is famously known among the seers and sages at Maha Kumbh mela as 'IIT Baba'.

Biden demands Constitution amendment to end presidential immunity in jab at TrumpUS President Joe Biden used his 15-minute farewell address tooffer a model for a peaceful transfer of power and  without mentioning Trump by name  raise concerns about his successor.

When Elisha Otis's daring elevator stunt shocked audiences to sell safetyIn 1854, Elisha Otis pulled off one of history's greatest marketing moves, performing a theatrical, public demonstration to prove his elevator safety device worked. This innovation would go on to reshape cities and enable skyscrapers, forever changing modern living.

Kerala High Court allows police to exhume body of man who attained 'Samadhi'The Kerala High Court has allowed the exhumation of Gopan Swami's body, rejecting his family's plea to halt the process. Gopan Swami's sons had claimed he attained 'Samadhi' before his death and buried him near a temple, sparking protests from locals and relatives.

US removes long-standing curbs on 3 Indian nuclear entities from trade blacklistThe decision, which affects Indian Rare Earths, the Indira Gandhi Atomic Research Centre (IGCAR), and the Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC), signals a significant step forward in bilateral collaboration, particularly in clean energy and advanced scientific research.

PM's hometown to get new Archaeological Museum showcasing 2,500 years of historyUnion Home Minister Amit Shah is scheduled to inaugurate the museum on Thursday, which is designed to offer a comprehensive look at the city's 2,500-year-old history through an immersive and interactive experience.

Saif Ali Khan attacked: Rest of the family is fine, says wife Kareena's teamAfter the attack on Saif Ali Khan, actor's wife Kareena Kapoor's team released an official statement. The team said that the rest of the family is fine.

Shilpa Shirodkar evicted from Bigg Boss 18, friends Karan Veer, Vivian break downActor Shilpa Shirodkar was evicted from Bigg Boss 18 days before the finale, leaving fans and housemates emotional. The top six contestants are Karan Veer Mehra, Vivian Dsena, Chum Darang, Eisha Singh, Avinash Mishra, and Rajat Dalal.

Saif Ali Khan was attacked in his children's room, suffers 2 deep stab woundsBollywood actor Saif Ali Khan was attacked at his Bandra home in a burglary attempt. He is currently undergoing surgery at Mumbai's Lilavati Hospital.

Saif Ali Khan attacked by intruder, hospitalised: Read statement from actor's teamActor Saif Ali Khan is hospitalised after being attacked during a burglary attempt at his home. The actor's team has requested his fans to be patient as they provide updates.

sports.headline: Brett Lee reviews Virat Kohli's tour of Australia, delivers verdict on battingFormer Australia fast bowler Brett Lee has reviewed Virat Kohli's woeful tour of Australia. Speaking on his batting, Lee said that it was very un-Kohli-like for the batter to edge the ball eight times in his nine innings.

Watch: Dinesh Karthik pulls off one-handed stunner for Paarl Royals in SA20Dinesh Karthik showed why he is still one of the best in the business as the Indian wicketkeeper pulled off a stunning one-handed catch during Paarl Royals' clash against MI Cape Town on Wednesday, January 16. Karthik's catch helped dismiss Azmatullah Omarzai.

Barcelona thrash Real Betis 5-1 to reach Copa Del Ray quarter-finalsFC Barcelona continued their rediscovered form to storm into the quarter-finals of the Copa Del Rey. Youngster Lamine Yamal starred as Barcelona beat Real Betis 5-1 on Wednesday.

Australian Open: Iga Swiatek continues streak, Emma Raducanu beats AnisimovaIga Swiatek thrashed Rebecca Sramkova to continue her unique grand slam streak, while Emma Raducanu secured a hard-fought win over Amanda Anisimova to make it to the 3rd round of the Australian Open for the first time. Both women will now face each other in the next round.

Trossard the hero as Arsenal win North London derby, Newcastle thrash WolvesLeandro Trossard was the match winner for Arsenal as they got back to winning ways by defeating Tottenham Hotspur 2-1 at the Emirates on Wednesday, January 15. Newcastle United continued their brilliant form, while Crystal Palace and Aston Villa also secured wins.

Rohit Sharma yet to confirm his availability for Mumbai's Ranji clash: ReportIndia captain Rohit Sharma's participation in Mumbai's Ranji Trophy match against Jammu and Kashmir is uncertain. The Mumbai selectors will follow the standard procedure to verify Rohit's availability before announcing the squad on January 20.

If Boland had not played, India would have won the series vs Australia: R AshwinFormer India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin feels that India would've won the recent Test series against Australia had Scott Boland not played in the rubber.

Pakistan selectors decide to name Saim in Champions Trophy provisional squadPakistan's cricket selectors have provisionally included Saim Ayub, recovering from an ankle injury, in the Champions Trophy squad. Despite not being officially announced, the squad features key players like Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf, with the option for changes till mid-February.

Sundar Pichai joins tech leaders in bid for London-based cricket team: ReportSundar Pichai has joined a group of prominent Silicon Valley leaders in a bid to acquire a London-based cricket team. According to a Bloomberg report, the consortium is eyeing ownership of either the Oval Invincibles or the London Spirit in The Hundred.

PCB hopeful Rohit Sharma will attend Champions Trophy opening ceremony in PakistanChampions Trophy 2025: The Pakistan Cricket Board is hopeful of hosting all 8 captains, including Rohit Sharma, for the opening ceremony in Pakistan. India will be playing all their matches in Dubai.

England's James Vince quits first-class cricket to play Pakistan Super LeagueEngland batter James Vince has announced his decision to step away from red-ball cricket for the 2025 season. This move opens the door for his participation in the Pakistan Super League (PSL).

Smriti, Pratika power India to record win over Ireland, 3-0 series sweepIndia women beat Ireland women in the third ODI by 304 runs and registered their highest victory margin in Women's ODIs as Partika Rawal won Player of the Match award.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Courtto recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination afterdiscrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
